channel.title: About on Yau Group
channel.description: Recent content in About on Yau Group

item.title: Academic Mentorship
item.description: Birmingham Academic tutees can contact me about all aspects of their studies that do not concern academic content. This includes: Issues affecting your ability to perform at your best in your studies Careers advice Academic references Enquiries related to specific issues around academic content should be addressed to the lecturer/module lead in question. All urgent or administrative enquiries should be directed to the relevant programme administrator in the first instance.

item.title: Research
item.description: Overview Our research is primarily concerned with the development of statistical and machine learning methodologies with a particular focus on applications in the biomedical sciences. A complete list of publications can be found on Google Scholar and our research software is available on Github Cancer Tumour heterogeneity describes the genetic diversity both within (intra-tumour heterogeniety) and between tumours (inter-tumour heterogeneity). Genetic differences within and between tumours give rise to different disease outcomes and patient responses to therapies.

item.title: Join Us
item.description: Postdoctoral Research Fellows [13 April 2019] A postdoctoral research fellow in statistical machine learning for cancer is available. To apply click here. PhD An open PhD Studentship is available to examine multimorbidity from electronic health records. To apply click here Admissions are currently being taken through the following study programmes, please see the websites for more details: MRC IMPACT Doctoral Training Programme Alan Turing Institute Potential applicants are encouraged to speak to the Group Leader before making applications.
